data.title: Flowers For Algernon
data.meta_description: New York: Harcourt, 1966. First Edition. Hardcover. 1st edition. A contemporary signed and inscribed presentation copy dated “1966” and few copies are seen that were dated in the year of publication. Fine in fine price clipped dustjacket clipped by Keyes when he gifted the book without a single nick, or tear, no fading, aging or soiling. Fine condition is scarcer than inscribed with this book. data.text:
New York: Harcourt, 1966. First Edition. Hardcover. 1st edition. A contemporary signed and inscribed presentation copy dated “1966” and few copies are seen that were dated in the year of publication. Fine in fine price clipped dustjacket (clipped by Keyes when he gifted the book) without a single nick, or tear, no fading, aging or soiling. Fine condition is scarcer than inscribed with this book. Fine / fine. Item #964

Originally written as a short story in 1959, Keyes expanded and polished “Flowers for Algernon” to complete the novel. Keyes use an ‘uplift’ device , increasing the intelligence of a mouse and takes it a step further to mirror the transformation of his human protagonist. It’s an influential book that has been awarded, successfully adapted multiple times, challenged and banned.
